lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/miku.MikuBot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run miku.MikuBot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Main class for the MikuBot application.
* Manages tasks, user input, commands, and save data. Provides an interactive console interface.
* Constructs a new MikuBot instance and initializes save data.
* Clears all saved tasks from the save file. Mostly for running tests.
* Executes a single command (used for unit testing or programmatic input).
* @return the output message or error message

* Prints the intro, populates tasks from save file, and repeatedly reads user input
* to execute commands until an exit command is received.
ui.print("Miku can't initialize the save file!");
String output = command.run(args, taskList, saveData, ui);

* A base abstract class for all bot commands

* @param usage the correct usage for the command, provided in errors and help functions

* @param usage the correct usage for the command, provided in errors and help functions
* @param toExit defaults to false if not given
public Command(String key, String usage, boolean toExit) {
* Just returns the usage of the command
* @return string containing the usage of the command
* @param arg the arguments for the command, if any.
*            Parsed into a Map mapping the argument keyword to argument value.
*            If command doesn't have arguments, the default key is 'default'
* @param tasks taskList from the main bot
* @param saveData saveDataManager of the main bot
* @param ui uiManager of the main bot
* @return string containing the output of the bot
* @throws IllegalCommandException if the command arguments are incorrectly formatted
* @throws FileIOError thrown with regards to save file issues
public abstract String run(Map<String, String> arg, TaskList tasks, SaveDataManager saveData, UiHandler ui)

* Parses a command to get its arguments

* Inserts a task with a deadline to the task list. Usage: deadline (task) /by (deadline)
* Deadline given must be a valid date
* Runs the command to add a deadline task. Does not add the task if there are any errors
* @param arg the arguments for the command, if any.
*            The given task name is passed into 'default' and the deadline is stored under 'by'
* @param tasks taskList from the main bot
* @param saveData saveDataManager of the main bot
* @param ui uiManager of the main bot
* @return a string declaring success or failure on addition
* @throws IllegalCommandException if bad argument formatting (eg bad dates, empty task, etc)
public String run(Map<String, String> arg, TaskList tasks, SaveDataManager saveData, UiHandler ui)
throw new IllegalCommandException("Miku cannot add an empty task :(", this.getUsage());
throw new IllegalCommandException("Deadline cannot be empty :(", this.getUsage());
throw new IllegalCommandException("Date must be formatted correctly!");
// tries to write to save file first, if fail abort the whole thing
return String.format("Miku has added this task to your list!\n" +

+ "deadline <task> /by <time>: adds a deadline task to your task list\n"

+ "unmark <index>: mark a task as not done\n"
+ "delete <index>: delete a task from the list\n"
+ "find <searchterm>: returns all tasks matching the searchterm";
